job_description:
In this role you will prepare financial analysis and reports for the NN Group Management board on business performance using Solvency-II (OCG), IFRS-17 and sales (VNB) metrics. In this very varied job, you will work on multiple projects enhancing insights to the financial performance of NN Group and their business units from a reporting as well as forecasting and business planning perspective.

The salary for this position is between € 4.332,- and € 6.189,- depending on your knowledge and experience. This is based on a 36-hour work week, excluding a 13th month and vacation pay.
Your impact as Financial Specialist Performance and Analytics at NN Group
The most exciting part of this job is de multi-scope role you will have, the insight you will have in all relevant financial impacts of the Group and the close contact with senior management. First and foremost, you are an financial specialist who will contribute to the analysis of the financial performance of NN Group both backward as forward looking. In addition, you are the advisor on financial and business related matters to the business units and relevant NN Group leadership. Your contributions to the financial performance reporting are of a high level, predominantly focused on key business drivers and mainly aimed to provide clear and actionable insights. All the while, you will play an important role in shaping the scope and implementation of IFRS17. For this part, you will write IFRS17 reports for senior management or analyze business units IFRS-17 reports. Moreover, you are writing internal IFRS-17 guidance (for instance Margin Analysis) and discuss IFRS-17 figures with business units.
Our Performance and Analytics team focuses on:
Drafting the Quarterly Performance Report in which business performance of all NN Group’s business units is discussed
Drafting the multi-year business plan for NN Group from an IFRS-17, Capital Generation and sales perspective
Analyze financial performance metrics and challenge business units on initiatives to improve performance (for example OCG, but also expenses)
Perform operational consolidation on the Solvency-II balance sheet of NN Group as well as analyzing operating capital generation (OCG)
Contribute to strategic projects of NN Group mainly from a financial point of view
Compare and report upon business performance compared to plan, past and forecast for both internal and external disclosure purposes
And we do a lot more, which gives you great opportunities to develop even further and have a very diversified role.
Your responsibilities
You will be business unit contact for one of the Dutch business units to understand and analyze the business and challenge on business driven actions to improve financial result
You will perform analysis on the financial result of NN Group and its business units to determine business driven actions for improvement
You will write financial reports for NN Group senior management on Solvency II (Operating Capital Generation), IFRS-17 both backward looking and forward looking
You will be involved in the IFRS-17 project to further implement IFRS-17
You will maintain and update Solvency-II consolidation tools together with the team members. In the quarterly reporting periods you are performing the consolidation of the Solvency II Balance Sheet and Own Capital Generation of NN Group
You will be involved in other projects. Examples of these projects are to draft the business plan for NN Group or to further improve management reporting processes
Your colleagues
You become part of our 12-person team Performance and Analytics. We are quite an international team with six different nationalities. In this role you will be part of the subteam focusing on NN Group and the Dutch business units consisting of 6 persons headed by the Manager Finance Business Performance.
Every Thursday, we work at the office; the other days you decide yourself, because that depends on your cooperation with other colleagues within NN.
The department Performance and Analytics is led by the Head of Performance & Analytics and directly reports to the Chief Financial Officer of NN Group.
Who you are
As a driven person, you have the mentality to get things done and to connect with others to succeed in your role. We can describe you as a team player who is able to collaborate effectively with both colleagues in (Group) Finance and Risk, colleagues in the Dutch business units as well as senior management. You also have:
An academic master’s degree in Econometrics, Actuarial Science, Finance or equivalent quantitative degree
A minimum of 4 years of experience gained insurance and experience in Solvency II and/or IFRS-17
Strong analytical and numerical skills to challenge and explain Solvency II and IFRS-17 results and identify business drivers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (in English) and the ability to communicate with and report to senior stakeholders
Very good command of Excel
Continue developing
It is important to us that you continue to develop yourself. We give you the space and the confidence to grow in your career and as a person. We help you with:
Plenty of training and learning opportunities in our Learning & Development Centre
A large (international) network of colleagues who are keen to share their knowledge with you
The autonomy to steer your own development path
Employee benefits
You are more than a colleague, and that is something we understand very well at NN. You have many roles in life, leading to different choices. At NN we give you the opportunity to select employee benefits that are important to you. In consultation with your manager and your direct colleagues, you can work from any location at any time. You get enough flexibility to adjust your working pattern to your personal needs. In addition, you will receive:
Collective pension scheme with a personal contribution of only 6%
194.4 hours of leave, based on a 36-hour week (that’s 27 vacation days for a 5-day working week) and one Diversity Day
Holiday allowance and a 13th month paid with your monthly salary
NS Business Card 2nd class, giving you unlimited travel 7 days a week. Do you prefer to travel with your own transport? Then you can declare the kilometers travelled for business and commuting.
All NN colleagues work in a hybrid form: on average two days at the office and working from home (or anywhere else). The official location for this job is our fantastic office in The Hague. The office is located next to the A12, but is also easily accessible by public transport. Want to catch some fresh air? You can take the tram or bike and you will be at the beach in half an hour.
Will you be our new colleague?
We would like to invite you to have a cup of coffee or tea. Because we believe that your enthusiasm about this position will only increase during that conversation. So, what are you waiting for?
Apply now

ABOUT THE JOB
The BI Solution Architect is a member of the MS AISE Data Function, supporting both new development/projects as well as BAU production support as the highest-level data architecture domain expert within MS AISE. The BI Solution Architect is responsible for the assessment of business requirements and the impact it will have on MS AISE’s data landscape. In this role the BI Solution Architect will lead on the design and build of Business Intelligence which is aimed at delivering key business insights in an efficient and effective way. This includes keeping oversight on as well as the creation of the data flow from source systems to datawarehouse to reporting.
The MS AISE BI Solution Architect will work in close cooperation with the Architectual team as well as the Data Services team within MS Amlin Business Service (MS ABS). Cooperation with the Architectual team will ensure Business Intelligence methods & standards are maintained and enforced. Cooperation with the Data Services team will ensure data engineering concepts and designs will meet operational requirements, such as scalability, maintainability, security, reliability, flexibility, etc.
This role is for an experienced BI Solution Architect and will report into the MS AISE’s Chief Data Officer (CDO).
Key Responsibilities
Participate in the MS ABS Data Architecture & Data Engineering forum on behalf of MS AISE to ensure we contribute to Group Enterprise Architecture and MS Amlins Architectual standards & Best Practices
Establish and maintain the data domain specific procedures and standards in close cooperation with MS ABS.
Ensure that relevant technical strategies, policies, standards and practices are applied correctly.
Support the MS AISE CDO in formulating the MS AISE Data Strategy, including the short / mid term roadmap and provide the necessary support and expertise to deliver the plan.
Provide advice on the technical aspects of BI development and integration, including the operational and maintenance aspects of existing systems as well as systems under development.
Provide technical expertise to: estimate level of effort, break down workpackages, technical resource planning for BAU as well as project related initiatives.
Contribute to dimensional data modelling concepts and practices to develop conceptual, logical and physical data models to support BI delivery in cooperation with MS ABS
Ensure the end to end solution design integrity is maintained during the delivery, overseeing the solution development process
Provide support resolving data quality issues when identified through data profiling, data analysis and / or stakeholder engagement.
Participate and lead research and development efforts (proof of concepts, prototypes) as subject matter expert. For example in cooperation with the central Data Analytics team within MS ABS, the London Digital Hub which is supporting local proof of value data analytics initiatives.
Identify, manage and help resolution of technical debt.
Support RFP /RFI processes from a data architecture perspective via weighed scoring matrices.
Key skills / experience
Significant experience as a BI Solution Architect
5+ years Experience in Business Intelligence / Reporting Solution Architecture Design
Experience with relational data structures, theories, principles and practices
Good understanding of Inmon / Kimball Data Warehousing Methodologies
Experience in Microsoft Business Intelligence Development Stack (DBMS / SSIS / SSRS / Power BI)
Alternative Experience in Business Intelligence Tooling (Tableau, Qlik, SAS VA, etc)
Experience in Cloud Technologies (Azure, Google Cloud, AWS, Snowflake) Advantageous
Experience in Wherescape Red & 3D Advantageous
Proven track record of successfully delivering BI and/or data warehousing projects
Demonstratable experience with data migration
Experience applying Data Privacy standaards ad ensuring GDPR compliance in a corporate environment
Track record of delivering results against tight timelines in an ambiguous environment
Knowledge of insurance market business applications & procedures and/or from an equivalent industry
Consulting experience to support multiple projects
Competencies
Strategic and analytical mindset
Ability to prioritise and execute critical deliverables
Ability to deliver from start to finish with minimal oversight
Pragmatic, self-starter and solution oriented
Ability to identify / anticipate problem areas before they occur
Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with senior stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to explain complex technical details in simple terms.
ABOUT MS AMLIN
MS Amlin is part of a global top-10 insurance group MS&AD, with three main legal entities’ operating in the Lloyd’s, UK, Continental European and Bermudian markets. We have an enviable reputation for our customer knowledge, claims service and the specialist insurance and reinsurance expertise we apply. We’re going through an exciting period of modernisation and transformation for which we need entrepreneurial thinkers to help execute our strategic vision for growth. We’re on a dynamic path and we need you to help shape it.

Our corporate (international) approach and an efficient proposition for the SME clients (supported by digitalisation initiatives) will be key to reach our final goal.

The team provides valuation oversight to Aegon Asset Management globally through detailed review of security valuations and application of market standard valuation methodologies.
Job Description
Aegon Asset Management (Aegon AM) is a leading global investor. Our 385 investment professionals manage and advise on assets of US $311 billion for a global client base of pension plans, public funds, insurance companies, banks, wealth managers, family offices and foundations.
We organize our firm around four investment platforms: fixed income, real assets, equities and multi-asset & solutions, which includes a fiduciary and multi-manager business. Each investment platform has dedicated teams with deep asset-class expertise, organized globally and committed to maximizing client benefit from their specialist areas.
We are an international business: Our 1,200 employees work from 13 locations across Europe, the Americas and Asia. We share a common belief in fundamental, research-driven active management, underpinned by effective risk management and a commitment to responsible investment.
Position Overview:
The Portfolio Accounting, Performance, and Valuation team is responsible for reviewing, calculating, and analyzing performance and attribution results. The team provides valuation oversight to Aegon Asset Management globally through detailed review of security valuations and application of market standard valuation methodologies.
The team supports the investment process by providing timely, insightful, fundamental, and quantitative feedback. The Portfolio Accounting, Performance, and Valuation team provides extensive analytic support to stakeholders and quantitative analysis to support the investment management process and commercial efforts. The team covers a wide array of public and private investment vehicles and diverse strategies while adhering to GIPS standards and principals.
Responsibilities:
Applies advanced understanding of valuation methods for financial instruments
Review valuations and valuation model outputs against thresholds and take necessary actions to accept or resolve exceptions
Participates in valuation model development and testing. Prepares required model documentation in compliance with policies and standards.
Collaborates with team members and related teams in assuring appropriate valuations for covered investments.
May create and/or update desktop procedures for assigned tasks and update key control documents for process changes
Identifies errors or concerns with team processes and for upstream/downstream processes
May address intermediate to complex queries from internal parties and/or auditors.
Required Qualifications:
Advanced Degree equivalent education and experience
CFA, FRM, MBA or similar; or ability/intention to acquire
~3 years of experience or more
A strong customer focus and stakeholder management skills
Security valuation experience in institutional investment industry
Good sense of humor
What are we offering?
Compensation levels depend upon an applicant’s qualifications and will be determined by hiring supervisors/managers and HR.
You will receive a thirteenth month and a holiday allowance in the form of a monthly flex budget, amounting to 16.7% of your monthly salary
Plenty of scope and budget for your personal development
A minimum of 27 holiday days
Reimbursement of your travel expenses
Discount on Aegon life insurance products
A good pension scheme

Aegon is an integrated, diversified, international financial services group. We are here to support every stage of a long, healthy life with guidance, financial advice, and propositions. 1. Purpose
The purpose of this role is to lead the development, execution and continuous improvement of pricing insights hub in accordance to the analytical and pricing requirements for the P&C business within MS AISE.
2. Dimensions
The MS AISE P&C Technical Pricing team has 7 people (Including 2 open positions), providing coverage for all P&C businesses within the Europe subdivisions. This corresponds to approximately €480m of gross net premium. The successful candidate will share responsibility across these regions with a particular focus on The Netherlands, but also in support of the other countries where needed (Belgium, France and UK). He/she will be responsible for the relevant pricing models and providing support to the respective underwriting teams.
3. Key Result Areas and Deliverables:
Develop a strong working relationship with the actuarial team and his management, underwriters, claims and Underwriting Management within MS AISE P&C;
Support the development and deployment of pricing models and ensure that models comply with the Technical Pricing Framework (“TPF”) and Pricing Policy;
Analyse external and internal data to build and validate technical pricing models;
Support, coach and advise underwriters in actuarial & technical issues, including case pricing, data analytics, renewal monitoring, Expected Loss Cost calculations and business planning, challenging where appropriate;
Support the business and underwriters on other actuarial related matters such as reserving and Internal Model parameterisation which are performed by other actuarial teams;
Work with management to monitor the performance of the business, for example in the Class Performance Reviews giving an independent opinion on the quality of the risks written and by improving business performance through portfolio analysis;
Maintain and develop management information available for analysis and reporting;
Provide requirements and lead development of insights hub and eventually own the insights hub product owner
Liaise with other functions within the company such as Catastrophe Modelling and Group Underwriting Modelling when required;
Coach and manage more junior members in the team when required.
4. The Operating Environment and Context of the Job
Under the Technical Pricing Framework (“TPF”) all classes are to be modelled consistently.
Pricing actuaries across MS AISE will develop models with underwriters. Responsibility for testing and deployment will lie with pricing actuaries who will support underwriting teams in their use of models. Work after the development period will focus on model maintenance and enhancement.
Further to the above, a significant proportion of the role will be on providing services to the Management and Underwriting teams on pricing and analytical matters.
The role requires a good knowledge of actuarial pricing techniques, in particular on the following classes:
Liability
Fire
Motor Fleet
Engineering
The drive to advance pricing in these classes is essential, along with the communication skills required to support underwriters through the changes.
It also requires a good knowledge, understanding and experience in data and analytics techniques, in particular on GLMs and machine learning techniques (boosting, random forest, clustering, etc.).
The role will work with the growing e-trading team to develop e-trade pricing tools as required.

Generic
Good interpersonal skills
Good communication skills in Dutch and English (both oral and written)
Ability to work well under pressure
Attention to detail and ability to self-check work – analytical mindset
Proactive, flexible and adaptable
Experience in being challenged and defending own views and position
Entrepreneurialism and ownership

Actuarial Pricing background and Experience (in P&C)
Machine learning Experience
Statistical and predictive advanced modelling Experience
Experience in European underwriting classes and environment
Advanced knowledge of Excel (including VBA)
Advanced knowledge of Python or R
Experience in SQL and/or SAS is an advantage

The primary interfaces of this role are with the P&C Management and Underwriting teams;
The successful candidate will be the first point of contact for pricing model and actuarial matters for their areas of responsibility;
Important interfaces within the Technical Pricing team for peer review and cross division collaboration;

Your impact as an Oversight Actuary of the NN
The most exciting part of this job is de multi-scope role you will have. First and foremost, you are an experienced actuary who will contribute to the execution of the central Actuarial Function within NN Group. In addition, you are the advisor on actuarial matters to the business units and relevant NN Group leadership. In your role you find solutions by connecting the right dots. You take your responsibility and really stand behind your own proposal, with sharp and clear arguments.
Your contributions to the group actuarial reporting are of a high level, predominantly focused on analytics and mainly aimed to provide clear and actionable insights from the actuarial reports to the Group Chief Actuary and other group stakeholders.
The business units can also count on your clear advice on topics like Solvency II models and assumptions, technical provisions, underwriting, reinsurance, ORSA, and more.
All the while, you will play an important role in shaping the scope and implementation of the IFRS17 group Actuarial Function responsibilities and activities going forward. For this part, you will review the IFRS17 liabilities and other metrics and provide advice to the Business Units, Chief Actuary and other corporate functions based on the outcomes.
Our Actuarial Reporting and Oversight team focuses on:
Actuarial SII oversight of business units, focusing on reserving, underwriting and reinsurance practices in the units
Review and guidance on material model and assumption changes
Ownership, maintenance, group-wide implementation and advisory role on policies and standards owned by the Chief Actuary Office (best estimate assumptions, market value of liabilities, Own Funds Movement Analysis, Operating Capital Generation, etc.)
Strengthening the actuarial function/community within the Group, enabling best practice sharing
Contributing to the IFRS17 project, including the development of value metrics and analysis of actuarial choices
And we do a lot more, which gives you great opportunities to develop even further.
